trial_identification.studytitle: A phase 1 study in healthy volunteers to determine the dermatopharmacokinetics of topically applied diclofenac in combination with the novel penetration enhancer Tocopheryl Phosphate Mixture (TPM), compared with Votaren(registered trademark) gel
trial_identification.scientifictitle: A phase 1 study in healthy volunteers to determine the dermatopharmacokinetics of topically applied diclofenac in combination with the novel penetration enhancer Tocopheryl Phosphate Mixture (TPM), compared with Votaren (registered trademark) gel

conditions.healthcondition: Muscular or joint pain relief in healthy volunteers currently experiencing no pain

conditioncode.conditioncode2: Research that is not of generic health relevance and not applicable to specific health categories listed above

interventions.interventions: A gel mixture of Tocopheryl Phosphate Mixture (TPM) and Diclofenac 1% and 2% applied topically to the volar forearms once for a 6 hour period. Each subject will receive 4 applications of 62.5mg each of each concentration
interventions.comparator: Voltaren Emulgel 1% applied topically to the volar forearms once for a 6 hour period. Each subject will receive 4 applications of 62.5mg each of Voltaren

primaryOutcome.outcome: Safety and tolerabilty of TPM/diclofenac assessed via adverse event monitoring and reporting.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Day 1 (dosing day) and Day 7 (follow up post dose)

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Dermatopharmacokinetics of TPM/diclofenac assessed by analysis of skin samples obtained by tape stripping
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Day 1 pre dose and 1, 2, 4 and 6 hours post dose

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Healthy males and females aged 18 to 55 years inclusive.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Pregnant or breast-feeding, skin conditions preventing gel application, current clinically significant medical conditions, on chronic medications, on medications which may interact with non-steroidal anti-inflamatory drugs

ethicsAndSummary.summary: This study is being conducted to see if a TPM/Diclofenac gel mix will penetrate into the skin more, and more quickly, than Voltaren. It will also assess how safe the gel mix is.
